channel.title: Grant scam
channel.description:
[b][size=24pt]EDIT: EVERMIND, FOUND THE ANSWER ITS A SCAM[/size][/b]
[b]Edit:http://scamoftheday.com/wordpress/category/scams/mentions-an-attorney/ Scroll down 3.[/b]
So I got an email that says I have received a 500$ grant from a university in Tennessee, known as Vanderbilt, which is odd because I don't live in Tennessee or know anyone in Tennessee. I did some further research to find out that the person who emailed me, Stacey Maple, graduated from Yale. It was the only Stacey Maple I could find. Has anyone had anything like this?
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2f09mz7.png[/img]
The main thing I find odd is "Daniel Richards" email is an address from Yahoo and not from Vanderbilt. Any speculation?

item.title: Grant scam
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Davidi2:

You reported your own post, what are you wanting me to do? It still seems like a valid thread (if you lower the font size a bit… ;))

Well I solved it. I guess if others should be warned…

Read full topic

item.title: Grant scam
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:2, topic:409905”]I get these types of emails from colleges all of the time. Literally, dozens of them are in my junk folder. If they want you to call that number it could possibly be to sign up for some type of subscription, and contacting that person by email will probably lead you to the number.

Also, the email address is .hk, which I’m guessing is Hong Kong? If so, don’t bother.[/quote]
Just found it’s a scam. Stacey Maple from vanderbilt doesn’t exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Grant scam
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I get these types of emails from colleges all of the time. Literally, dozens of them are in my junk folder. If they want you to call that number it could possibly be to sign up for some type of subscription, and contacting that person by email will probably lead you to the number.

Also, the email address is .hk, which I’m guessing is Hong Kong? If so, don’t bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Grant scam
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[size=24pt]EDIT: EVERMIND, FOUND THE ANSWER ITS A SCAM[/size]

Edit:http://scamoftheday.com/wordpress/category/scams/mentions-an-attorney/
Scroll down 3.

So I got an email that says I have received a 500$ grant from a university in Tennessee, known as Vanderbilt, which is odd because I don’t live in Tennessee or know anyone in Tennessee. I did some further research to find out that the person who emailed me, Stacey Maple, graduated from Yale. It was the only Stacey Maple I could find. Has anyone had anything like this?

2f09mz7.png1598×961

The main thing I find odd is “Daniel Richards” email is an address from Yahoo and not from Vanderbilt. Any speculation?
